markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Blackfrost Guecubu](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2509)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 29

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 8">[Blackfrost Guecubu](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2509)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="CE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Cold" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=27" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #189: Dreamers of the Nameless Spires](/Sources.aspx?ID=195) pg. 31</row>

**Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) (imprecise) 60 feet

**Languages**
[Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +16, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +18, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +15, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +16

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +4

**Con** +3

**Int** +4

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +3
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 27 

**Fort** +17 

**Ref** +16 

**Will** +15 

</row>

**HP** 110
([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42))

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

**Resistances**
[electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56) 10, physical 10 (except bludgeoning)

**Shattering Death** ([cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27)) When the blackfrost guecubu is destroyed, it shatters and fills the air around it with a cloud of razor-sharp shards of ice. Creatures in a 10-foot emanation take 8d8 cold damage (DC 26 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). Creatures that critically fail this save also take 1d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, burrow 15 feet; tundra glide

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 2d8+8 piercing plus [blackfrost](/Curses.aspx?ID=51) and wrathful misfortune

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 26
- **4th**
[Shape Stone](/Spells.aspx?ID=276) (at will)

**Break Ground** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The guecubu stomps, and the ground breaks and ripples in a 30-foot emanation, erupting in razor-sharp, crisscrossing spikes of rock that deal 3d8 piercing damage to creatures in the area (DC 26 basic Reflex save). The area becomes difficult terrain and hazardous terrain, with each square dealing 3 piercing damage to a creature that moves through it. A guecubu is immune to these effects. Ground under the effects of a [_consecrate_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=8) ritual or a [_circle of protection_](/Spells.aspx?ID=38) spell tuned against evil or chaos can't be affected by this ability.

**Shove into Ice**  ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) When the blackfrost guecubu successfully [Shoves](/Actions.aspx?ID=38) a creature into an ice or frozen earth barrier, the target must succeed at a DC 26 Reflex save or become merged with the barrier, with the effects of [_meld into stone_](/Spells.aspx?ID=188) until the target [escapes](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) (DC 26).

**Tundra Glide**   The blackfrost guecubu can [Burrow](/Actions.aspx?ID=93) through any frozen earth, ice, or snow, not including rock. When it does so, the blackfrost guecubu moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

**Wrathful Misfortune**  ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61)) A creature damaged by a guecubu must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or become cursed with consummate bad luck. The creature becomes [clumsy 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3). Each time that creature rolls initiative, on their next roll they must roll twice and use the worse result; this is a [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110) effect.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-333" />
name: Blackfrost Guecubu

Creatures in a 10-foot emanation take 8d8 cold damage (DC 26 basic Reflex save). Creatures that critically fail this save also take 1d6 persistent bleed damage. --- Speed 25 feet, burrow 15 feet; tundra glide Melee Single Action jaws +20 (Agile), Damage 2d8+8 piercing plus blackfrost and wrathful misfortune Primal Innate Spells DC 26 - 4th Shape Stone (at will) Break Ground Two Actions (Arcane, Earth, Transmutation) The guecubu stomps, and the ground breaks and ripples in a 30-foot emanation, erupting in razor-sharp, crisscrossing spikes of rock that deal 3d8 piercing damage to creatures in the area (DC 26 basic Reflex save). The area becomes difficult terrain and hazardous terrain, with each square dealing 3 piercing damage to a creature that moves through it. A guecubu is immune to these effects. Ground under the effects of a consecrate ritual or a circle of protection spell tuned against evil or chaos can't be affected by this ability. Shove into Ice (Arcane, Earth, Transmutation) When the blackfrost guecubu successfully Shoves a creature into an ice or frozen earth barrier, the target must succeed at a DC 26 Reflex save or become merged with the barrier, with the effects of meld into stone until the target escapes (DC 26). Tundra Glide The blackfrost guecubu can Burrow through any frozen earth, ice, or snow, not including rock. When it does so, the blackfrost guecubu moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing. Wrathful Misfortune (Arcane, Curse, Enchantment) A creature damaged by a guecubu must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or become cursed with consummate bad luck. The creature becomes clumsy 2. Each time that creature rolls initiative, on their next roll they must roll twice and use the worse result; this is a misfortune effect.
